Package ooga.model.initialization.fileparsing

Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
ooga.model.initialization.fileparsing.XMLParser
public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles parsing XML files. It has methods to get string to node maps, as well as string to string maps.

  • Method Details

    • makeRootNodeMap

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node>> makeRootNodeMap​(java.io.File dataFile, java.lang.String fileType, java.lang.String gameName) throws ClassLoaderException
      Given a file, makes the map that has the name of each direct child of the document element and the node objects that represent them. Does some error checking for the file type as well
      Parameters:
      dataFile - The file to read in
      fileType - The type of file that is expected (piece, board, etc)
      gameName - The name of the game that the file corresponds to
      Returns:
      The map for the child nodes of the document element
      Throws:
      ClassLoaderException - If the file type and game name aren't correct

    • makeNodeMap

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node>> makeNodeMap​(org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
      Given a node, makes a map that has the name of each direct child node and the node objects that represent these names
      Parameters:
      parentNode - The parent node that has children to be parsed through
      Returns:
      A map of the string of the node name to the list of all the node objects with that name

    • makeAttributeMap

      public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> makeAttributeMap​(org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
      Given a node, will make a map of the names of the children of the nodes to the text values that they hold. This method assumes that each node will only have text as the child, and not other nodes. It will still execute otherwise, but the map will likely not contain the desired data
      Parameters:
      parentNode - The node that will be used to make the map
      Returns:
      The map with the children of the nodes mapped to their text values

    • makeNodeList

      private java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Node> makeNodeList​(org.w3c.dom.Node parentNode)
